abstract: Street artist Hans Honschar, who is known, and remunerated, for his chalk sidewalk drawings on Upper West Side of Manhattan, is arrested for drawing heart on information board in Brooklyn subway station with washable marker, and scheduled to appear in court on April 7; Honschar claims his work is art, not graffiti.

headline.print_headline: A Painted Heart Leaves a Black Mark on an Artist’s Record
headline.main: A Painted Heart Leaves a Black Mark on an Artist’s Record

snippet: Hans Honschar said his creation, with a subway signboard as his canvas, was art, but the Police Department called it graffiti. Their difference of opinion played out on an R line platform in Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: Hans Honschar said his creation, with a subway signboard as his canvas, was art, but the Police Department called it graffiti. Their difference of opinion played out on an R line platform in Brooklyn.
